formattedAddress: 230 Central Park S, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 230 Central Park S, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text: I've been lucky enough to interview Jason Kim about his work both here in the states with some of the world's most recognizable celebrity faces, and abroad. He truly is an artist, and treats every case like its own individualized masterpiece. Speaking to him about the different shades of white and how they enhance a person's features and why there is no one right of white for each person is honestly fascinating. He is a painter, a sculptor, a musician, a professor, and all of this funnels into why he is NYC's most sought after Master Ceramist.

originalText.text: Hello, my name is Dr. Burdo. I was fortunate enough to have had Jason Kim create two veneers, to cover my  peg laterals. I can't tell you how amazing the entire process was and how happy I am. What I love most is the fact that Jason individualizes, all of his work, to ensure that your smile is bright, yet natural. Every aspect is tailored to be my perfect smile!

text.text: Hello, my name is Dr. Burdo. I was fortunate enough to have had Jason Kim create two veneers, to cover my  peg laterals. originalText.text: I hesitated to use the most expensive lab (by far) that I had ever seen.  I sent them a study model of a case and the case came back nothing like the study model..it was grossly overcontoured.  I had to grind the veneer down with a coarse diamond.  This was over an hour chairside with patient wondering why she paid extra to use this lab....when you pay $500 for a veneer that you are accustomed to paying $250 for you don't expect it to need gross correction.  YOu don't expect it to need ANY correction.  The patient had to get the veneers in that day and so we slogged through the process.  I sent a photo of the veneers before I recontoured them to the lab.... I don't even know if they looked at the study model...It was a disaster.
